answers.answer: I don't know all the answers, but there could some malabsorption going on here.  The chronic fatigue may even be Chronic Fatigue Syndrome, because of the hair falling out.  I know the lower right pain you're talking about, because I get that, too.  It usually comes when the colon isn't happy.  The bloating you're talking about is also likely coming from the colon.Have you had your thyroid tested recently?  You may need to adjust your thyroid medications if you're on thyroid medications.  Or, you may need to start using some thryoid medications.As odd as it sounds, I actually think that this time it's your thyroid that is causing these symptoms.  I do think the lower sugar intake is still a good idea, though.  Prevention is a good thing in the world of adult onset diabetes.  The hunger may even be related to the thyroid.  Most people don't get this hungry going gluten free.And, it may be too soon to give up on the gluten free diet.  You're body may be a lot like mine and is trying to release some built up toxins.Have you tried cooking quinoa?  (Pronounced keen-wah)  Quinoa has no gluten, but it is actually much higher in protein than wheat is.  It is a great grain to use for breakfast.  Many are satisfied with quinoa and almond milk as breakfast.  If you're still hungry with that, you can try adding more protein to your breakfast with a boiled egg or some scrambled eggs.  I find that a higher protein breakfast like this in the morning really helps a lot with the rest of the day.
